basics.name: Andrew Gibbons
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am currenly working towards a B.S. in Mechanical Engineering with a minor in Computer Science at the University of Hawaii at Manoa. I have previously earned a B.S. in Natural Resources and Environmental Management from the College of Tropical Agriculture and Human Resources at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2025.

education.area: Mechanical Engineering, minor in Computer Science (expected Spring, 2025)

work.company: Renewable Energy, Industrial Automation, and Precision Engineering (RIP) Lab | University of Hawaii
work.summary: At the RIP lab I work on optical design and component integration for a fast luorescence laser and sensor system intended for marine application which will be tested by the US Navy.
highlights: Work with project managers, researchers and stakeholders on ensuring designs meet intended goals and desires.
Utilize OnShape to collaboratively develop 3D models and conduct FEA analysis.

work.summary: In this position I managed and worked with a group of fellow students as we attempted to create a tool for increasing high school student's resilience to mis/disinformation online.
highlights: Conducted interviews for 50 stakeholders to understand their pain points so that a product could be catered to them.
Led technical research and design of an MVP
Helped develop a website which allows users to understand the kinds of mis/disinformation threats which are online in a gamified fashion.

work.summary: In this position I looked at identifying trends in equipment breakdown from the company's maintenance logs. This information can be used to implement preventative maintenance measures in the future.
highlights: Gained experience working with real world databases and the challenges that come with imperfect data collection.
As this was my own individual summer project, I got perform all aspects of the job from data acquisition, to data cleasing, to data analysis, to my reccomended plan of action.
Created a visual representation of my work in PowerBI and presented it to stakeholders.

work.summary: Contracted by the Army to manage endangered species and conduct forest restoration accross Oahu.
highlights: Monitor, maintain, protect, and grow endangered species populations.
Expand native forest coverage accross Oahu.
Conduct surveys and write technical reports on findings.
